entry.title: The Phoenix Project
entry.content:
I read this about 8 months back and would definitely recommend (even mandate it) as reading for anyone involved in a technology company. Not only is the book an enjoyable read (quite remarkable when it's about your workplace), but it is very instructive on concepts such as work in progress & kanban. What is special is that it takes place in the context of the Operations/Infrastructure department, which in my experience is slower to buy into these ideas.

You can purchase it on Amazon or it should be in any good bookstore.

entry.title: New Website!
entry.content:
So I have decided to switch from the custom setup I had before (based of the python framework flask & apache) to a much simpler one using Jekyll & nginx. Why Jekyll? Well it is one of the more popular static site generators & I have some experience from converting my sister's website over to it a few months back (beckymiller.co.uk). Currently I have used the Hyde theme as it caught my eye, but I hope to move to my own design before long.

Given Jekyll is designed for blogs, I hope to start writing more posts, especially since I have now setup Travis CI to deploy this site automatically.
